programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: The virtual world has real consequences in Mike Hammer's latest case. Mike Hammer is offered a case by the worried grandmother of a missing young woman. Tamara had been working as a model for a racy website before her disappearance, and when Hammer's team discovers a snuff film posted online, he worries that she may have been victimized by something much more serious. Mike Hammer is on the case to either find Tamara, or bring her murderers to justice.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mayron Hughes may be one of the most sought after basketball players in the country, but the mysterious death of his former agents could threaten everything. The star athlete hires New York's most valuable private eye in order to prove his own innocence. The case becomes increasingly complicated, and the Hammer must look at an entire roster of suspects in order to find the real killer. From Mayron father to his new agent to Mayron himself, anyone could be the culprit.

programme.desc: The team searches for a young girl who was kidnapped from a cabin during a family vacation; Maggie questions her relationship with Nestor when she learns he hasn't been completely honest with her.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: A Hollywood actress with hometown ties to Hammer becomes the primary suspect in the gruesome murder of her own producer and boyfriend. In order to clear her name, she asks Mike to finds the real killer. The East Coast's best private eye must head West to get to the truth behind the lies. But as Hammer conducts his investigation, the situation in Malibu turns sticky, and he discovers that nothing is as it seems.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: It's Devil's Night in New York, and this year's Halloween festivities prove especially deadly. Before their date, Mike Hammer's love interest is murdered in her own apartment. With his heart broken and his own life on the line, Hammer must track down the heinous murderer. With Hammer's friends being targeted, he discovers a pattern that points to a cultist killer that he had locked up before. Mike must solve the case quickly, or he could be next.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: An operating room with dead nurses, doctors, and patient draws serious questions, but something doesn't smell quite right. The daughter of the patient, whose body odor was believed to be the source of the deadly fumes, brings the case to Mike along with some suspicious questions about the nature of the hospital's treatment plan for her father. Something's just not right, and Hammer is determined to find out what.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: After a prostitute is murdered, Father Dressler is worried about the women who work nights in his neighborhood. The holy man asks Mike Hammer, a former parishioner, for help protecting the local ladies of the night but the rules of the confessional forbid him from giving Hammer too many details. When Dressler ends up dead, Mike Hammer is on the case, and he takes a position that is not so forgiving.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: A successful stock broker on Wall Street is murdered in cold blood, and Andy the janitor is the first one to find his body. But when the simple man gets blood on his hands and accidentally incriminates himself, he turns to Mike Hammer to help him clear his good name. Hammer sees that Andy is innocent, but his attempt to find the real culprit is nearly foiled by a series of traps and pitfalls that evade the private eye's keen intuitions and continue to make the janitor look guilty.

programme.desc: How would the military respond if UFOs suddenly invaded restricted U.S. airspace? It allegedly happened, and the team gets a rare interview with the Military Air Traffic Controller who was there.

programme.desc: New evidence suggests there was more than one UFO crash near Roswell. On July 8, 1947 at 5:26 EDT, an Associated Press news wire announced that soldiers from Roswell Army Air Field in New Mexico recovered a "flying disk" from a nearby rancher's property.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classic
programme.desc: Business cards found at a murder scene plus 38 years of advances in DNA technology reveal the killer of a 19-year-old New York woman. And, the lead suspect in a 22-year-old murder

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: In early 1984, three-year-old Vanessa Bennett becomes the lone survivor of her family's brutal murder.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: When a 30-year-old mother fails to report for duty in Virginia, the Army lists her as AWOL. Her family immediately suspects foul play and embark on a 13-year quest for answers.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: Firefighter Gary Parks is killed in a fire ruled arson, the investigation into his death shifts to homicide. A serial arsonist is thought to be the culprit.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: For five years Cindy Brown was married to Bobby Joe Long. During that time she was physically and emotionally battered by her husband who would go on to kill 10 women in Florida.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: When Tony Antonucci took up an apprenticeship with local contractor John Wayne Gacy, he had no idea that his new boss was an active serial killer.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: In December 2006 the bodies of five sex workers were discovered in Ipswich. It was a terrifying time for Jade Reynolds who worked in the red light district.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: Jane Carson Sadler was brutally raped but survived at the hands of a man who murdered 13 people.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: On June 12, 2016, Omar Mateen walked into Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida and massacred 49 people while wounding an additional 53, in the deadliest attack in American history.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: Richard Beasley was a conman and serial killer who posed as a preacher and in 2011, posted advertisements on Craigslist to entice men to work with him on his farm.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: In an exclusive interview, Drew Peterson's eldest son shares for the first time his memories of being raised by the man who he once admired above all others, his father.

programme.title: City Confidential
programme.desc: East Millinocket, Maine, is brought to its knees when its most popular teen turns up dead; for 38 years, answers elude police; with the help of a dedicated mother and a community that never forgets, the secret killer is finally exposed.

programme.title: City Confidential
programme.desc: Murders are rare in tranquil Delta Township, Mich., so when a well-liked couple is gunned down in their home, residents are terrified -- until police discover the monster accidentally left a trail of breadcrumbs leading right to his door.

programme.title: City Confidential
programme.desc: A brutal double murder shocks Northern California's peace-loving and laid back Marin County; with residents reeling, police chase an elusive killer through three counties and multiple crime scenes to unravel a twisted tale of terror.

programme.title: City Confidential
programme.desc: When a young woman's body is pulled from the ocean off the Big Island, Hawaii, accusations threaten to destroy the local community; as tensions grow, a surprising discovery leads detectives to a devastating truth that no one saw coming.

programme.title: City Confidential
programme.desc: When an infant's body washes up on the shores of Deer Island, Mass., residents rally to find out who she is, and what happened to her; their unprecedented solidarity gets nationwide attention, helping police solve a heartbreaking mystery.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: After a devoted mother and her two children vanish suddenly, investigators work to expose the truth behind why they never came home.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When 18-year-old Conrad Roy is found asphyxiated in his pickup truck, his death is quickly ruled a suicide; as detectives retrace Conrad's final moments, texts left on his cell phone reveal a toxic romance between him and Michelle Carter.

Despite dwindling interest and a two-decade-long losing record, a determined coach and group of young athletes fight to keep their football program alive. An exploration in overcoming loss, the film follows the personal triumphs and hardships of the players and their families, and how football serves as a symbol of hope, unity, and resilience for the people of Red Lake.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: The film traces the evolution of activism on the part of players of color through generations, shining a light on the realities of being a Black athlete in the NFL then and now.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Down three runs with two outs in the ninth, the Red Sox fought back against the Yankees.

programme.title: MLB's Carded
programme.desc: Former All-Star Dmitri Young tells Greg Amsinger how he became an elite card collector while also playing in the big leagues on MLB's Carded.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Take an exclusive tour of Oriole Park at Camden Yards, the baseball stadium built in 1992 that revolutionized modern ballpark design.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Jim Leyland steered the Marlins to their first ever franchise World Series win against Cleveland, a series that lasted seven games in 1997. Edgar Renteria hit the walk-off single in the 11th inning which plated Craig Counsell securing the conquest.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Brandon Woodruff homers and earns the win to lead the Brewers to a win in Game 1 of the 2018 NLCS.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 3/14/17: Yadier Molina and Javier B√°ez back Team Puerto Rico's dominant pitching in their 3-1 win over Team Dominican Republic

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series MVP Mariano Rivera leads the Yankees to the franchise's third championship in the last four seasons and 25th overall, sweeping the Braves in four games in a rematch of the 1996 Fall Classic.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ichiro Suzuki makes history in 2007 by hitting the first-ever inside-the-park home run during an All-Star Game. He was rewarded MVP for going 3-for-3 at the plate and collecting two RBIs in an American League victory, 5-4.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Fernando Valenzuela throws a complete game and Ron Cey hits a homer to help the Dodgers win Game 3.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: In 2015, Wilmer Flores' walk-off homer amid trade rumors for the Mets showcased resilience and loyalty, endearing him to fans and etching his place in team history.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Dodgers' ace Clayton Kershaw strikes out 15 Rockies in a near-perfect no-hitter.

programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: MLB stars from the AL and NL face off in San Diego in the 1992 All-Star Game.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series MVP Mariano Rivera leads the Yankees to the franchise's third championship in the last four seasons and 25th overall, sweeping the Braves in four games in a rematch of the 1996 Fall Classic.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Take an exclusive tour of Boston's Fenway Park, the oldest Major League Baseball stadium still in use. The park has plenty of unique features such as Pesky's Pole and the Green Monster

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: In one of the greatest single-game World Series performances of all-time, Pablo Sandoval gets the Giants off and running with a three-homer game in Game 1 against the Tigers.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: A historic 10-run 1st inning helps propel the Cardinals to the NLCS over the Braves

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Standing in the way of the Yankees' third-straight World Series championship are their crosstown rivals, the Mets - back in the Fall Classic for the first time since they won it all in 1986.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The 1993 All-Star Game was held at Oriole Park at Camden Yards. The American League stands tall again in their 9-3 victory over the National League.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 11/4/01: Fueled by Luis Gonzalez's epic game-winning line drive in the bottom of the 9th inning against Mariano Rivera and the Yankees, the D-backs' late-inning magic led to their first franchise World Series victory in an exciting seven-game clash.

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: MLB Network takes a deep look into the life and career of legendary Reds hall of fame catcher Johnny Bench

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On June 29, 1990, Fernando Valenzuela shows the world what he still has in his left arm. After allowing three walks and striking out seven batters, Valenzuela completes a no-hitter against the Cardinals.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Facing a 10-1 deficit late in the ballgame, the Orioles score five runs in both the 7th and 8th innings to stun the Red Sox.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the mid-engined, GMC Crew Cab, road-going dragster 500 miles to the Roadkill Zip-Tie Drags at Tucson Dragway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Last time the guys tried to rescue this 1977 Chevy El Camino, the result was a transmission fluid spill that can still be seen from space; now it's back as the guys attempt a road trip to the Merrill Ice Drags on a frozen river in Wisconsin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Building 440-powered Suzuki Samurai entirely out of a junkyard in Arizona.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Old fashioned, fun road trip in random, unreliable junk; David and Mike buy a 1966 Ford Econoline flat-face pickup, sight unseen, and hit the road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike play around in hot-rodded pickups with a few friends.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan's loved Chargers since he was a kid; he recently bought a long-abandoned '68 Dodge Charger that's lasted 48 years in as-built condition; Finnegan works with buddies Tony Angelo, David Newbern and Daniel Boshears to bring it back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Taking a 50-year-old car from a junkyard and motoring it to the 14,115-foot summit of Pikes Peak in Colorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David, Mike and Steve throw cars off a cliff at Glacier View in Alaska.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Draguar makes an epic return all the way to racing at NHRA Nationals.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint Challenger is back with an upgraded suspension and it's ready to dominate the autocross; David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich enter Tire Rack SCCA Solo Nationals in Lincoln, Neb., a mere 1,700 miles away.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a Roadkill challenge like no other; David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are joined by Motor Trend hosts for an all-out war on tires.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike salvage a Road Runner that had an encounter with a pole.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike work on improving their Mazdarati mini-truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip a big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada to Du Quoin, Illinois.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip two beaters to a deserted factory for a winter battle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys' attempt at a Hemi Gremmie road trip is foiled by engine trouble.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan buy an '86 Trans Am and take it for its first road test on the drag-and-drive event Sick Week; with a swapped 350 V8 and a six-speed, the big question is whether they be able to make it faster each day or even finish the race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger attempt to get a bucket-list '66 Corvette -- abandoned halfway through an LS swap and restoration -- back on the road. With multiple iterations and attempts, the 'Vette hasn't been on the road for 30 years. Will they change that?

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern light the tires as they road test their LS-powered '66 C2 Corvette from Oakland to Las Vegas with the smokiest burnouts ever. Follow along as they blaze the coast and hit the drag strip with Dulcich before breaking down in Sin City.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan meet up with Derek Bieri to take a 1968 big-block Dart on a tire-smoking road trip, which includes a final run down Memphis International Raceway and some high-speed passes down George Ray's Wildcat Dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern revive the '73 Chevy Ramp Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan surprises Freiburger by fixing up the Gremmie for Roadkill Nights.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A road trip keeps Freiburger distracted prior to the Hemi Gremmie surprise.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the Hemi Gremmie from Detroit to St. Louis.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys fix and tune their way to Arizona to rescue a '75 Dodge Dart.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crusher Impala gets a new 9-inch rear and a suspension overhaul.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: After a tune up, the '69 Crusher Impala hits the road and the dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich and Wiley Stevens prep two cars for a farm rally course.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freibuger and Dulcich can't pass up buying a '41 Ford former race car.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong join Dulcich to revive the Wreck Runner.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys take a '68 Dart home for an engine bay makeover and tune-up.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys revive Roadkill's '66 Dodge D100 to dig out a buried '60 Ranchero.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys bring a '60 Ford Ranchero back to life after 40+ years of neglect.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys work on the Crusher Impala to see if they can get it to run 10s.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong help transplant a Hemi into the '74 D100.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich attempt to get a '67 Jeep Wagoneer back on the road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys take on a 1971 Rally Red Duster that hasn't moved since 1993.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The team tries to outdo themselves with a redesign of 1950 Ford F5 COE.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The client asks for a last-minute engine swap on the '50 Ford F5 COE build.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Bill and the team fix another shop's botched lift on a 2017 Ford F-350.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A '65 Ford Falcon Club Wagon is transformed into a custom family cruiser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A 1973 El Camino is transformed into the Ride of the Future.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: After a long pause, the team gets their chance to finish a 1968 Chevy C10.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1937 International Harvester gets a big old Cummins 12-valve diesel engine that's as heavy as the truck itself; a 2005 Chevy Colorado gets a new lease on life as a nitrous-infused drag truck.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: HOF running back Earl Campbell arrives with the parts of a 1949 Cadillac,

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: NFL Hall-of-Famer Earl Campbell made a career mowing down defenders, so the guys take the same hell-bent approach to rebuilding his 1949 Cadillac; they also customize a van for a disabled motocross rider so he can drive again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A long-time client wants to improve upon a near-perfect '68 Ford Ranger; the team is up to the task with an all-new custom chassis, handmade interior, rebuilt bed and Coyote 5.0 engine swap; the guys check off new custom upgrades on a '75 Bronco.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 Impala throws the guys for a loop when they discover it's an imposter; the team makes it better than ever, with custom body fabrications, rear subframe and handmade interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and his team make one of their longest custom chassis ever for a new 2020 Denali, and Ekstensive gets a diesel pro-mod drag car back on the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets d√©j√† vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.desc: Clearwater, Florida is in competition with Miami for showcasing electrifying matchups and bare-knuckle talent. A unique venue hosts Richman vs Lozano in the main event, Fortt vs. Brito in the co-main and Ridge vs. Randall.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Angel Hernandez vs. Rayne Wells, Jessica Borga vs. Katharina Lehner, Jay Jackson vs. Idrees Wasi and Abdiel Velazquez vs. Travis Thompson help kick off a nine-fight Fight Night in Clearwater, Florida.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Some of the most dominant performances from KnuckleMania IV. Mike Perry headlines against Thiago Alves, Lorenzo Hunt looks to make history against heavyweight champ Mick Terrill, Jeremiah Riggs welcomes Alfredo Angulo to the Squared Circle.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Before the halfway point of the evening, Los Angeles had already put on a phenomenal show. Complete with upsets, dominance and five-round bangers.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In a historic and first ever trip to Connecticut's Mohegan Sun Casino, Natalie Gage vs. Sarah Click, Rick Hawn vs. Stephen Stengel, Mike Trizano vs. Louie Lopez and Jimmie Rivera vs. Daniel Straus make an outstanding account for BKFC talent.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: A stacked fight card in Omaha features some heavy hitters in intriguing matchups! Watch BRAUN vs MCINTOSH, GROSU vs MARTINEZ,COCHRANE vs HOLLOWAY &TRINIDAD-SNAKE vs PAGUE as they battle during a Fight Night.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In three epic clashes, JOSH KREJCI welcomes NATE MORROW to the Squared Circle,TOMMY STRYDOM takes on COREY ROBERTS and BOBBY TAYLOR goes to war with RYAN ROBERTS. Don't miss these incredible showings of toughness from Omaha!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Prospects throw down in a handful of first-time showings in Denver with RAMIRO FIGUEROA vs BRETT HUDSON and JOSH HUBER vs ANDREW YATES. Also, in BKFC veteran matchups, CRISTINA CRIST, CASSIE ROBB, SAWYER DEPEE and KEEGAN VANDERMEER match up.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch some serious showings of toughness and skill asJOSEPH CREER vs DANIEL MITCHELL,ZEB VINCENT vs CASEY MOSES,DERRICK FINDLEY vs SERGIO LOPEZ &DYLAN SCHULTE vs ROBERTO ARMAS lay it all on the line in Denver.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Three titles are on the line in Hollywood, Florida with WARREN vs ESCOBOZA fighting for light heavyweight gold, BLAS vsRICHARDSON battling at bantamweight and bad blood boils over as BRYAN DURAN comes for KAI STEWART'S featherweight strap!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In a showcase of incredible bare-knuckle matchmaking,LEONARDO PERDOMO vs LEO BERCIER,GEE PEREZ vs ALBERT INCLAN,CHRISTINE VICENS vs MELANIE SHAH &JUSTIN IBARROLA vs RICK CARUSO demonstrate the grittiness of BKFC.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: More of the best from BKFC 64 in Coventry, UK! Robbie Brown vs Jordan Ward, Luke Levin vs Shane Omer & Connor Cooke show the world why the UK is still a big player in the sport of bare-knuckle!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In four tough-fought wars, we see none of these bouts go the distance! Watch BKFC talent battle with SIMPSON vs SUAREZ,ZUCKERMAN vs CEDENO,PLAZAOLA vs DODSON &GARCIA vs LIVINGSTON at BKFC 62.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In an absolutely electric showing for the BKFC debut at the Pechanga Resort & Casino,VICTOR ROSAS vs LUIS INIGUEZ,FERNANDO GONZALEZ vs RODNEY THOMAS &RUBEN WARR vs ROBBIE PERALTA shock the crowd with jaw-dropping scraps!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch exceptional matchups & brutal finishes from Pechanga's first ever BKFC Fight Night! Featuring HANSEN vs YOST,VO vs PETTIT,GUTIERREZ vs GARCIA &VILLASENOR vs FIELDS.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Not a single fight from Pechanga disappointed the live audience, nor the viewers at home! Watch some of BKFC's warriors toe the line in. Featuring JORDAN CHRISTENSEN vs RILEY PELLEGRINO,JOSEPH WHITE vs CALEB AVILA &SQUIRE REDFERN vs RICHARD BROOKS.

programme.desc: While trapped in the ghost town saloon, Lucas tries to come up with a plan to escape with his son and Micah after Mark refuses to leave without him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lou Mallory arrives in North Fork and starts buying up land and businesses. Lou and Lucas start disliking each other after she reveals plans to build a railroad on "worthless" land.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: New Orleans' underworld conspires to rub out administrator Colton right when Colton's sister Agatha finally arrives on a visit. Yancy expected a Boston battle-ax, but he's smitten with her charm and wit. Colton has a heavy workload, fending off crime czar Lance Carter, and wowing Agatha with his Reconstruction wizardry, while building a romantic blockade between her and Yancy.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Mr. Proctor, a friend of the Derringer family, is sent to New Orleans with a message from a former general in the Civil War. But before he is able to relay the message to Yancy, Mr. Proctor is assassinated, leaving Yancy to uncover the mystery behind the Confederate half dollar Mr. Proctor was carrying when he died.

programme.desc: After the death of her husband, Mrs. Lowe (Ann-Margret) posts a $50,000 reward in return for help recovering her train-robber beau's hidden fortune, under the pretense of returning it. Lane (John Wayne) assembles a group of cowboys to head to Mexico with Mrs. Lowe, enticed by the reward money. As they cross into Mexico, however, they realize they're being followed, by both a posse of bandits and a single mysterious rider (Ricardo Montalban) with his own agenda.

programme.desc: While trapped in the ghost town saloon, Lucas tries to come up with a plan to escape with his son and Micah after Mark refuses to leave without him.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.desc: Nils Swenson takes the marshal's place for a few days while Micah is away. To maintain peace, Nils insists that anyone coming into town must turn in their weapons.

programme.desc: A murder occurs at a railroad camp and a young Indian friend of Lucas' is accused of the killing. When Lucas tries to help the boy, he finds himself on trial.

programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.desc: Jackie‚Äôs faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.desc: Darlene‚Äôs thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.desc: Dan‚Äôs ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: A Bell Family Christmas
programme.desc: Secrets come to light as the Bell family celebrates Christmas in their new home in this story of family, friendship, faith, and forgiveness.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Headed South for Christmas
programme.desc: An angst-ridden teen longs to meet the mother who died during her birth, as her dad takes her to spend Christmas with relatives they barely know.

programme.title: A Frosty Affair
programme.desc: An unexpected road trip during a blizzard with a stranger to make her wedding forces a small-town teacher to take a hard look at her life choices.

programme.title: A Raunchy Christmas Story
programme.desc: Friends throw a secluded holiday bash to put romance back into a friend's life, unaware that an investigative reporter and a Russian spy are guests.

programme.title: A Vineyard Christmas
programme.desc: The host of Read Between the Vines envisions her perfect Christmas episode at a unique local winery whose stubborn owner wants nothing to do with it.

programme.title: A Very English Christmas
programme.desc: A woman coordinates her half-sister's Christmas Eve whirlwind wedding in the English countryside with the help of a handsome market owner.

programme.title: Coupled Up for Christmas
programme.desc: Hoping to reunite with her longtime crush, Tiffany joins forces with heartbroken Peter in order to win back the hearts of their respective soulmates.

programme.desc: A cynical candle maker agrees to help an ambitious wellness expert develop a line of Christmas scents in order to fulfill his daughter's holiday wish.

programme.desc: A designer and wealthy heir must team up to bring holiday magic to a small community, making both realize they wish to spend every Christmas together.

programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Blackpool and confident John welcomes his rivals to the Lynbar Hotel. He says his breakfast is the best in Blackpool and hopes his guests will agree.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Wales and the School House bed and breakfast, owned by eco-friendly couple Jayne and Ian, where they hope their environmental approach will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey and Assistant Manager Jo Goodwin. Guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but the costs prove hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Leafy Suburban bed and breakfast in Northwood, where golfer Raj Kumar opens the doors to his home. However, Neil and Jo are not impressed with a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Wellington Inn in Hertfordshire where resources manager Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach to hosting - but the `Welly' twist is not a hit with everyone.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Strontian Boutique in Strontian, Scotland, where Callum Pegg and his partner head chef Darren Anderson want to treat their guests to an exclusive stay.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Helix Hotel in Grangemouth, Stirlingshire, where host Nawaz Haq wants to show off his hotel, catering to the travelling businessman. Come morning, the group raises concerns over the breakfast banquet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Black Boy Hotel in Sudbury, where hosts Kate Martin and sister Marie Carlton want their guests to kick back and embrace the historical surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to The Lodge Bed and Breakfast in Cannock, Staffordshire, where hosts Lee and Marie Garnett are hoping their guests take to their homely BandB, but have they done enough to win?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent run by 21-year-old partners James Tindall and Jessica Walton, who believe age is but a number. Over breakfast, a frank airing of views sets the standard for the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, run by mother and daughter duo Amanda and Becci. On arrival, everyone is wowed by the stylish shepherd huts with outside bath.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions are simmering as the guests head to The White House in Brighton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business. The criticism continues, with feedback that leaves the hosts praying for a miracle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Edenmore Guest House in Ardrossan, owner Hugh Begbie dreads the prospect of guests who are too `kissy-kissy, touchy-touchy'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day two of the competition is at Grassington Lodge in Yorkshire, where owner Diane Lowe reckons `Diane's little touches' have helped make her rooms a cut above.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jeanette and Andrew Collette are the third hosts to open their doors in this particular competition. They welcome their fellow B and Bers to their homestay - Manor Farm in Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final visit is to The George and Dragon in Princess Risborough, Buckinghamshire, owned by fun-loving publicans Ian and Elle Betchley.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Langsmeade House in Thame, Oxfordshire, Dutch-born owner Marianne Abben and her trusty housekeeper Fran Birchwood are hoping to meet some troublemakers.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Stratford House Guesthouse in Stratford-upon-Avon, where couple Natasha and Dai Pollock juggle the demands of bringing up a young family with running a B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal in Kent where owner Michael Prime is joined by his doting mum Lorna.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This visit is to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire, where entrepreneur Mark Genders hopes his guests will think his small rooms are perfectly formed. However, he admits his `very' honest appraisal of his rivals' offerings may work against him.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off at Nateby Inn in Cumbria, where landlady Gaynor Walker is ready with a warm welcome. A trip to Gaynor's local brewery turns out to be a barrel of laughs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Ravensden, Bedfordshire, where owners Graham and Julia Ashley run Outfields Farm B&B. The hosts treat their guests to an adrenaline-fuelled afternoon at an indoor sky diving centre.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to At Home in Chiswick, London, where artist Bob Osborne takes a laid-back approach to running his B&B. Guests are pleasantly surprised by their first impression of Bob's communal living space-come-mini art gallery.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Chard, Somerset, where Andrew and Clare Ashmore own the Ammonite Lodge guesthouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The new competition kicks off at Abbey House in Penrith, Cumbria, where Ian Sugden sees himself as the `brawn' in the operation while his wife Sam, a part-time nurse, is the `brains'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Compton House, in Newark, Nottinghamshire, Lisa Holloway prides herself on providing a home from home for her guests. Sadly, Sam and Ian Sugden are disappointed by the dust, while Dave and wife Jo, find the price for a night hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate hope their guests at The White Horse pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, will embrace the pub vibe, but sadly Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked in their room by mistake.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Old Farmhouse in Cheshire, where retired teachers Ed and Jane Mitchell shock some of their guests by offering only a shared bathroom, but that's nothing compared to Sam and Ian's reaction to what they find under the bed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit this week is to Knockaloe Beg farm on the Isle of Man, where owners Fiona and John Anderson hope their guests will embrace their green ethos. Blackpool B&B'ers Robbie and John Welling are surprised that it is so clean 'for a farm'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Arches on the Isle of Man where ex-demolition man Phil Routledge is proud of his super-modern B&B, which was voted the best in the Isle of Man. On arrival, his guests are blown away by the views.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Trafford in Blackpool owned by couple Robbie and John who are proud of their traditional bucket and spade B&B. On arrival the guests are pleasantly surprised, even if previous host Phil is hell-bent on finding some dust.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the grand Sheepy Lodge in Warwickshire where empty-nester Julie loves to fill her manor house with people - as long as they don't order poached eggs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Dunsandles Guest House in New Brighton, Merseyside, owner Alan Johnson and his best mate and professional sidekick Dave Owen hope to be crowned best value B&B of the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This visit is to the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, owned by Nick and Gina Mead.The afternoon entertainment is some freezing competition out on the locks.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the competition is to York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition is at Heyford House in Lower Heyford, Oxfordshire. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock sees as a perfect opportunity to settle some scores with Dave and Alan.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Oak Tree Cottage in Burley, where owner Jacqui Castle is the first to host.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Rising Sun Inn in Bath, where owners Lorraine Hawkins and Norman Butcher hope to bring their guests up to standard by having a dress code.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's program Gordon Ramsay travels to the seaside to help ailing hotel and restaurant, The Sandgate. This is Lois and Peter's first venture into the catering industry - the happily married couple used to enjoy eating in restaurants, so thought it might be fun to own one. 18months later their dream has turned into a nightmare and they're loosing ~¬£4,000 a month.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: This week Gordon is at a god-awful Italian restaurant in Derby. La Gondola is stuck in a time-warp with naff Seventies cuisine, bad net curtains and no customers. New owner Daniela bought the place because she got married there back in the day but her sentimentality has blinded her to the fact that she's bagged a white elephant. Gordon's biggest problem is head chef Steve, one of the worst he's ever met, and one who'd rather open a tin of tuna or a packet of soup than create a proper meal. Can Gordon get the kitchen cooking again and save La Gondala from sinking?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E02 - Episode 2

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E03 - Episode 3

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's program is Clubway 41, despite being voted Blackpool Tourist Board Restaurant of the year, the place is dire straits. It is the prime example of HOW NOT TO RUN A RESTAURANT. Owner DAVE is the flakey self-appointed head chef, who hasn't been in a kitchen for 30 years and can't cook. His partner DAWN invents bizarre dishes for the menu, ranging from "tomato and cointreau soup" to "pork with brie, nectarine and whiskey sauce". Gordon faces a hellish week, Clubway 41 is breaking every rule in book, can he bring Dave, Dawn and their food back to earth?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight's program sees Gordon Ramsay in Oscars in Nantwich. On the surface this place seems idyllic, an Irish family run restaurant in the heart of beautiful countryside. Owner MAURA runs the front of house and her son LENIN is the Head chef, but it's not "happy families". With her life savings on the line Maura is in big trouble. She constantly bickers with her son whilst the customers are forced to wait hours for their fluorescent crab stick paellas, and stodgy carbonaras from Oscars "bit of everything" menu.

programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the most exciting talents from London and the South East region are competing for a place in the national finals. Head chef Mark Froydenlund runs Marcus Wareing's two star restaurant. Russell Bateman is head Chef at The Grove in Hertfordshire and Ronnie Murray who heads up the Hix Restaurant group.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and chef Russell Bateman is celebrating the diversity of his beloved home town of London - by combining lobster with jerk spices for an ambitious fish course with seven key elements. Ronnie Murray's taking a risk with an ingredient which is close to the veteran judge's heart and is planning to serve it at three different temperatures, warm, deep fried and frozen. And two Michelin-starred Mark Froydenlund is planning a novel way to present his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the all-important main course and returning contender Mark Froydenlund is banking on it being his strongest dish. Russell Bateman is creating a beef dish, and Ronnie Murray's mixing a crown of lamb with a curried filling.

programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.desc: It is main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. Judging the chefs' dishes are Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton and guest judge John Williams MBE, executive chef of The Ritz.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain‚Äôs seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden

programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair Wiggins heads out the farthest he‚Äôs ever been offshore with Capt. Mike Avanon & Capt. Chris Broome in search of a species he‚Äôs never caught before.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Escape to the beautiful shores of Grand Isle, Louisiana where musician and community advocate David St. Romain joins Chef Jay Ducote for a weekend of fishing, crabbing, and oyster harvesting. Watch as Chef Mark Boudreaux of Hurricane Hole transforms their fresh catch into a culinary feast. Enjoy the thrill of fishing, the joy of cooking and the camaraderie of camp in The Bayou State.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode of Tidewater Diaries, Captain C.A. embarks on a captivating journey with offshore fishing YouTube sensation Captain Nick Stanczyk of StanzFam, renowned as the "Swordfish King." Together, they unravel the secrets behind Captain Nick's legendary status, sharing thrilling tales of swordfish expeditions on the open seas. The episode not only explores the intricacies of swordfishing techniques but also delves into the rich history of Bud & Mary's Marina. Through a nostalgic lens, Captain C.A. and Captain Nick vividly depict the marina's origins, capturing the essence of its enduring significance in maritime culture.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter‚Äôs Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Argentina but has moved locations from La Pampa to Patagonia in search of a Pere David's Deer. programme.title: The Journey Within

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's next adventure takes him west to Nevada for a giant bull elk with an early rifle elk tag in his pocket. This is why he loves the tag system, you never know when you're going to get a tag. This area provides one of the best elk tags in the state of Nevada. Mark is bringing his brand new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC rifle to the high mountains of the Nevada desert.

programme.title: The Journey Within

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he ventures into Croatia‚Äôs wild heart, hot on the trail of a legendary stag. In the midst of the rutting season‚Äôs deafening roars, tensions escalate as Mark closes the distance.Equipped with his Gunwerks 7LRM, things get dicey as Mark is face to face with a roaring stag at 12 yards!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Argentina but has moved locations from La Pampa to Patagonia in search of a Pere David's Deer. Pere David's deer are native to China but thrive in the wet swamps of Argentina. In the heart of the Red Stag roar, Mark and team put on the miles for two days before they catch up to a giant Pere David's Buck.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in Croatia, and on the third day, they decide to venture to the coast where he will pursue his hunt on one of the numerous islands that permit hunting (Dugi Otok Island). Armedwith his trusted Gunwerks 7LRM Rifle, Mark prepares to stalk the diverse array of exotic animals inhabiting these islands, offering him a rich selection of prey to choose from.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in for an adrenaline-packed adventure in Croatia as he targets the elusive Kri Kri Ibex and Mouflon. With expert guides and unwavering determination, Mark navigates rugged terrain and thrilling hunts, showcasing the excitement and skill of the hunting industry.As his time in Croatia winds down, the episode captures the essence of ethical practices and the intense pursuit that defines this exhilarating sport. Don‚Äôt miss the epic conclusion to Mark‚Äôs expedition, where passion, skill, and the thrill of the hunt converge in unforgettable moments.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's next adventure takes him west to Nevada for a giant bull elk with an early rifle elk tag in his pocket. As a non-resident, Mark had less than a 1% chance to draw this tag with Worldwide Trophy Adventures (WTA) TAGS Program. This is why he loves the tag system, you never know when you're going to get a tag. This area provides one of the best elk tags in the state of Nevada. Mark is bringing his brand new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC rifle to the high mountains of the Nevada desert.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is still in Veracruz, Mexico chasing after a free-range Axis Deer. With warmer temps still presenting challenges, Mark and his guide head to a Michon overlooking a pond full of crocodiles. With the temps getting as warm as 90 degrees, the Axis deer search for water to stay hydrated. With time running out on the final day, they catch movement in the brush and a beautiful Axis buck steps out to take a drink.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Hellions
programme.desc: A small-town policeman (Richard Todd) stands alone against a family of outlaws in 19th-century South Africa.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fiance√©, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.
